definition.text: Ireland is a sovereign parliamentary republic in Western Europe occupying most of the island of Ireland. Since the late 20th century, it has transformed into a high-income, small open economy characterized by strong foreign direct investment inflows, a competitive corporate tax regime, and specialization in pharmaceuticals, information technology, and financial services within the European Union framework.

works.title: Actor Set Evolution of Ireland
works.description: Temporal mapping of Irelandâ€™s actor space from colonial administration and independence to state-led development, EU integration, and FDI-driven multinational clustering.

works.title: Economic Transformation Dynamics
works.description: Structured timeline of Irelandâ€™s shift from agrarian economy to export-oriented, knowledge-intensive sectors during the Celtic Tiger period and beyond.

works.title: Multinational Corporate Network Structure
works.description: Network analysis of multinational enterprises operating in Ireland, sectoral concentration patterns, and integration into EU and global value chains.
